subject: Skips enabling kernel bridge firewall in container
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-03 17:18:51.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/linuxbridge_agent', 'lib/neutron', 'lib/neutron_plugins/ovs_base', 'functions', 'lib/nova'], 'message': "Skips enabling kernel bridge firewall in container

Calling enable_kernel_bridge_firewall inside a
container, devstack will crash because it tries to
load a kernel module by calling 'sudo modprobe' on
net.bridge.

Change-Id: Id4718c065d5a8c507d49f38e19c2796a64221aa4
Closes-Bug: #1662194
(cherry picked from commit 0bf75a471ecce8c05718644e7e070b4d5a8657d6)
"}]
commit_message:
Skips enabling kernel bridge firewall in container

Calling enable_kernel_bridge_firewall inside a
container, devstack will crash because it tries to
load a kernel module by calling 'sudo modprobe' on
net.bridge.

Change-Id: Id4718c065d5a8c507d49f38e19c2796a64221aa4
Closes-Bug: #1662194
(cherry picked from commit 0bf75a471ecce8c05718644e7e070b4d5a8657d6)

commit_message:
Added is_debug_enabled helper

This is to allow consuming projects to avoid direct access to debug
configuration option that is defined by the library. This is in line
with general oslo guidelines about accessing oslo options from inside
consuming projects' code.

Change-Id: Ic1ae2d3f0e198ac367c1ad785f3d8dc13335282f

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-17 02:00:17.000000000', 'files': ['heat/common/serializers.py'], 'message': "Stop showing json deserialized message in log

We stop showing json deserialized message in debug log, because
message will involved with some private credential message (like
password). Let's block it for now, until we get a better solution.
Partial-Bug: #1664792

Change-Id: I07410df56449c5414a5572d07507e17f5858c5c6
"}]
commit_message:
Stop showing json deserialized message in log

We stop showing json deserialized message in debug log, because
message will involved with some private credential message (like
password). Let's block it for now, until we get a better solution.
Partial-Bug: #1664792

Change-Id: I07410df56449c5414a5572d07507e17f5858c5c6

subject: Change to messagingv2 for oslo_messaging_notifications.driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-05 18:09:45.000000000', 'files': ['lib/cinder', 'lib/nova', 'lib/glance', 'lib/neutron-legacy'], 'message': 'Change to messagingv2 for oslo_messaging_notifications.driver

The oslo.messaging docs on the notification messaging driver
says that "messaging" (1.0) is a legacy format and you should
use messagingv2 unless otherwise required for that old format.

By default we should be testing with messagingv2.

Change-Id: I3031afe7551a0c8dde46e1ccfacff445fb68e122
'}]
commit_message:
Change to messagingv2 for oslo_messaging_notifications.driver

The oslo.messaging docs on the notification messaging driver
says that "messaging" (1.0) is a legacy format and you should
use messagingv2 unless otherwise required for that old format.

By default we should be testing with messagingv2.

Change-Id: I3031afe7551a0c8dde46e1ccfacff445fb68e122

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-03-06 10:43:19.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/fuel/examples/cobbler.pp', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/provision/netboot', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/master/cobbler_spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/fuel/templates/systemd/dnsmasq_template.erb'], 'message': 'Raise start limit burst for dnsmasq

When we provision nodes, we can
restart dnsmasq to frequently
this leads to systemd not starting
dnsmasq again, thus we have dnsmasq
stopped and deployment failing.

Raise limit to 100 starts in 10 seconds
and also sync cobbler on netboot disable

Partial-bug: #1667006

Change-Id: Id14bb2bb162f0a9fc6e0a9a102d98f4f2a6dcf1a
'}]
commit_message:
Raise start limit burst for dnsmasq

When we provision nodes, we can
restart dnsmasq to frequently
this leads to systemd not starting
dnsmasq again, thus we have dnsmasq
stopped and deployment failing.

Raise limit to 100 starts in 10 seconds
and also sync cobbler on netboot disable

Partial-bug: #1667006

Change-Id: Id14bb2bb162f0a9fc6e0a9a102d98f4f2a6dcf1a

subject: Enable timeout for http_request
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-04 16:49:32.000000000', 'files': ['templates/haproxy.cfg.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Enable timeout for http_request

This fix supports to configure timeout for http-request which in turn
helps in avoiding DDOS Attack. This ensures HAProxy to let five seconds
to a client to send its whole HTTP request, otherwise HAProxy would
shut the connection with an error.

Change-Id: I2e6b886e6c1e4a63ecb6513cd2d2672ac738a909
(cherry picked from commit 00ec5971ab426ebc786c11778dc9869d33eed5b7)
'}]
commit_message:
Enable timeout for http_request

This fix supports to configure timeout for http-request which in turn
helps in avoiding DDOS Attack. This ensures HAProxy to let five seconds
to a client to send its whole HTTP request, otherwise HAProxy would
shut the connection with an error.

Change-Id: I2e6b886e6c1e4a63ecb6513cd2d2672ac738a909
(cherry picked from commit 00ec5971ab426ebc786c11778dc9869d33eed5b7)

commit_message:
Skip RDO install on RabbitMQ nodes

Installing RDO on RabbitMQ nodes causes package conflicts for
RabbitMQ. EPEL already provides RabbitMQ/erlang packages.

This patch skips the RDO installation on any RabbitMQ containers.

Closes-Bug: 1670012
Change-Id: I766a03c30f1383fe0a1435c154865001703b1582

Earlier we used to translate properties only when

commit_message:
Don't translate when resource_validate=False

Earlier we used to translate properties only when
strict_validate=True in resource INIT. This misses
nested stacks. As we want to avoid this for
`template-validate` we can use resource_validate flag
instead.

Change-Id: I62c9d9a5cb147ace8d49f408677aaaaff109c605
Closes-Bug: #1582844
(cherry picked from commit 75b13f77ac70ea8822cb2f6d4db5ffc6911e8cb3)

commit_message:
DNM: use libvirt.images_type=flat by default

We have test coverage already for the ploop, rbd, lvm and
qcow2 image types in the libvirt image backend.

We don't have a job that uses flat/raw (yet), so this is
just a one-off patch to test the refactor series in nova
with the flat backend.

Related to nova blueprint libvirt-instance-storage

Depends-On: Ie4d5904e7bc2dcea8aa3f6c84c30b28431a232dc

Change-Id: I5a31172b9a4fb86504adffd96bc466de22977df5

subject: Fix incorrect cinder start order
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2243, 'name': 'John Griffith', 'email': 'john.griffith8@gmail.com', 'username': 'john-griffith'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 8099, 'name': 'Graham Hayes', 'email': 'gr@ham.ie', 'username': 'graham'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-12 19:25:51.000000000', 'files': ['lib/cinder'], 'message': 'Fix incorrect cinder start order

In Mitaka's Cinder Upgrade Notes [1] it is mentioned that the
cinder-backup service should be the last to be upgraded and restarted:

"As cinder-backup was strongly reworked in this release, the recommended
upgrade order when executing live (rolling) upgrade is
c-api->c-sch->c-vol->c-bak."

But devstack starts Cinder Backup service before Cinder Volume, which
can lead to problems during grenade jobs [2] where we see this error:

"ServiceTooOld: One of cinder-volume services is too old to accept such
request. Are you running mixed Liberty-Mitaka cinder-volumes?"

This patch changes the order so the cinder volume service is started
before the backup service.

[1]: http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/cinder/mitaka.html#id6
[2]: http://logs.openstack.org/58/350758/1/check/gate-grenade-dsvm-designate-powerdns/90b0f2d/logs/new/screen-c-bak.txt.gz?level=ERROR

Change-Id: Idca0abc45ca314c4319c39f9a8d59ebeac7a720e
Closes-Bug: #1612781
'}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect cinder start order

In Mitaka's Cinder Upgrade Notes [1] it is mentioned that the
cinder-backup service should be the last to be upgraded and restarted:

"As cinder-backup was strongly reworked in this release, the recommended
upgrade order when executing live (rolling) upgrade is
c-api->c-sch->c-vol->c-bak."

But devstack starts Cinder Backup service before Cinder Volume, which
can lead to problems during grenade jobs [2] where we see this error:

"ServiceTooOld: One of cinder-volume services is too old to accept such
request. Are you running mixed Liberty-Mitaka cinder-volumes?"

This patch changes the order so the cinder volume service is started
before the backup service.

[1]: http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/cinder/mitaka.html#id6
[2]: http://logs.openstack.org/58/350758/1/check/gate-grenade-dsvm-designate-powerdns/90b0f2d/logs/new/screen-c-bak.txt.gz?level=ERROR

Change-Id: Idca0abc45ca314c4319c39f9a8d59ebeac7a720e
Closes-Bug: #1612781

subject: Remove centralized policy delivery spec from backlog
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-28 22:31:50.000000000', 'files': ['specs/keystone/backlog/centralized-policies-delivering-mechanism.rst'], 'message': "Remove centralized policy delivery spec from backlog

This was something we discussed during a recap of the Pike PTG:

  http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/keystone/2017/keystone.2017-02-28-18.00.log.html#l-231

There are a lot of policy discussions in flight the conflict with the
ideas specified in this specification. Which ever approach we decide
on as a community will likely need a new proposal.

Removing this from the backlog so that we don't mislead new
developers or people who frequently reference our backlog to gauge
project direction.

Change-Id: Ida5387ceef2823a2d54d94313fca783ba518e54d
"}]
commit_message:
Remove centralized policy delivery spec from backlog

This was something we discussed during a recap of the Pike PTG:

  http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/keystone/2017/keystone.2017-02-28-18.00.log.html#l-231

There are a lot of policy discussions in flight the conflict with the
ideas specified in this specification. Which ever approach we decide
on as a community will likely need a new proposal.

Removing this from the backlog so that we don't mislead new
developers or people who frequently reference our backlog to gauge
project direction.

Change-Id: Ida5387ceef2823a2d54d94313fca783ba518e54d

commit_message:
Remove microversions spec from backlog

This was a discussion that we had at the Pike PTG in Atlanta and is
recapped in our weekly meeting:

  http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/keystone/2017/keystone.2017-02-28-18.00.log.html#l-47

This commit removes the microversions spec from the backlog because
there are some overall decisions regarding microversions that need to
be made at the API-WG level. Once those issues are resolved, we can
repropose a more accurate representation of the spec.

commit_message:
Raise tox version to install as per tempest requirement

There was regression in tox 2.2.0 for env-substitution
with setenv. It is fixed in 2.3.1

Tempest has raised the tox min version to 2.3.1 to fix above issue
so devstack needs to install that as per tempest requirement.

Change-Id: I50015024c88b53ac4e4ff3b0ef6e2839b109fbda

commit_message:
Add can_branch_stable.py tool for detecting release edges

This adds a tool that lets you check to see if all dependent projects
have cut stable branches yet. This should help in determining when we
can branch stable devstack.

commit_message:
Upgrade rootwrap configuration for Neutron L3

This patch upgrades the rootwrap configuration for the Neutron
L3 agent, so that patches requiring new rootwrap configuration
can be tested with grenade.

Related neutron patch: Ie47126e010876400f5a9a6e661e4d3709bfc10dd

Change-Id: Icef8cf430211c4782e86f94262e4dc889680d862
Closes-Bug: #1527018
Related-Bug: #1462154

Patch fixes _horizon_config_set in scenarios where an option (variable in a
module) already exists and replaces its value instead of deleting it
and then appending to the end of module that can resutl in a NameError
if the variable is reference ahead of its declaration.

'}]
commit_message:
Fixes _horizon_config_set to replace variables in modules

Patch fixes _horizon_config_set in scenarios where an option (variable in a
module) already exists and replaces its value instead of deleting it
and then appending to the end of module that can resutl in a NameError
if the variable is reference ahead of its declaration.

Fixes Bug1532658

Change-Id: I0fe5db6554f782eed95c3b0214a0e053c9c6530c

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-12-02 16:19:01.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tempest'], 'message': 'Configure tempest to not use security groups for cells

Currently, any tests which use security groups are excluded from
the gate-tempest-dsvm-cells job since cells does not support
security groups.  The exclusion is done using a blacklist
in:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/devstack/tempest-dsvm-cells-rc

Change devstack to set the tempest config option,
compute-feature-enabled.security_groups,
to False if cells are enabled.  This will allow the blacklist
to be pruned.

Another change set is dependent on this change:
Nova change to remove the security group related tests
from the blacklist.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/226043/

Change-Id: I4f74b80024a9bcc374d374d86052dceb40598d32
Closes-Bug: 1495653
Depends-On: Icd62f42809380de6d638b343d3322b102b0d1d1f
'}]
commit_message:
Configure tempest to not use security groups for cells

Currently, any tests which use security groups are excluded from
the gate-tempest-dsvm-cells job since cells does not support
security groups.  The exclusion is done using a blacklist
in:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/devstack/tempest-dsvm-cells-rc

Change devstack to set the tempest config option,
compute-feature-enabled.security_groups,
to False if cells are enabled.  This will allow the blacklist
to be pruned.

Another change set is dependent on this change:
Nova change to remove the security group related tests
from the blacklist.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/226043/

Change-Id: I4f74b80024a9bcc374d374d86052dceb40598d32
Closes-Bug: 1495653
Depends-On: Icd62f42809380de6d638b343d3322b102b0d1d1f

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-12-12 12:18:19.000000000', 'files': ['functions.sh'], 'message': 'Fix branch fallback logic

d-g supports running out of a development branch called other than
master, defined in GIT_BRANCH.

The current branch fallback logic ignores that, and after ZUUL branch
and ZUUL ref it falls back to master.

Adding the ability to fallback to GIT_BRANCH, if defined and existing,
or else to master.

Change-Id: I1e9c2d756bf5bd911891c6c5f8da68a65845731c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix branch fallback logic

d-g supports running out of a development branch called other than
master, defined in GIT_BRANCH.

The current branch fallback logic ignores that, and after ZUUL branch
and ZUUL ref it falls back to master.

Adding the ability to fallback to GIT_BRANCH, if defined and existing,
or else to master.

Change-Id: I1e9c2d756bf5bd911891c6c5f8da68a65845731c

commit_message:
Add total time to stdout

Add total time to stdout
  total time is shown in stack.sh.log.summary already.
  but it cannot see on stdout.
  This is for viewing each processed time like pip with this.

Output example is follows

This is your host IP address: xx.xx.xx.xx
This is your host IPv6 address: 2001:258:8404:121c:250:56ff:fe9b:2e13
Horizon is now available at http://xx.xx.xx.xx/dashboard
Keystone is serving at http://xx.xx.xx.xx:5000/
The default users are: admin and demo
The password: nomoresecrete
stack.sh completed in 483 seconds.

Change-Id: I0a3df77fbdac1912ca285d52c1f91b8588acd1ae

commit_message:
Remove old messaging notify driver alias

15cd99050c6d2714b90059e0faad9f9e3409eaaa added this alias
to workaround an issue with neutron using the internal
path in liberty. That was fixed in neutron in mitaka:

225663888e71d44e9732951f515da925b8799b74

The alias was left for liberty, but liberty is end of life
now so we can remove this.

commit_message:
Do not post allocations that are zero

When posting allocations for VMs with a non-local disk, the code was
sending an allocation of DISK_GB = 0, which violated the min_unit
resource constraint. Since it is pointless to enter an allocation of
zero units, this patch removes any items in the generated allocations
dict if the value is zero.

Closes-Bug: #1647316

Change-Id: I59eff4310e67ceb74086f5ade1a637f8cccec7ed
(cherry picked from commit 200666ad19e44fb76aab29ed664767885b259822)

Ironic nodes that are not available or operable have 0 values for vcpus,
memory_mb, and local_gb in the returned dict from the Ironic virt driver's
get_available_resource() call. Don't try to save these 0 values in the

commit_message:
placement: Do not save 0-valued inventory

Ironic nodes that are not available or operable have 0 values for vcpus,
memory_mb, and local_gb in the returned dict from the Ironic virt driver's
get_available_resource() call. Don't try to save these 0 values in the
placement API inventory records, since the placement REST API will return an
error. Instead, attempt to delete any inventory records for that Ironic node
resource provider by PUT'ing an empty set of inventory records to the placement
API.

Closes-bug: #1651678

Conflicts:
        nova/scheduler/client/report.py
        nova/tests/unit/scheduler/client/test_report.py

NOTE(mriedem): The test conflict is due to refacoring change
1870c75c45a99f879ac7dc0ab5e5b30ad82880cb not being in
stable/newton. The report.py conflict is due to change
13ba33a57488f5e553dcca7162cc35b58ff0e7f8 coming before this.

Change-Id: I10b22606f704abcb970939fb2cd77f026d4d6322
(cherry picked from commit 3c217acb9c55d647ca362320d697e80d7cfa5ceb)

commit_message:
[placement] Enforce min_unit, max_unit and step_size

Add support for checking min_unit, max_unit and step_size when
making allocations to the placement API. When the constraints are
violated a new exception InvalidAllocationConstraintsViolated is
raised.

Change-Id: I18596a3c0f2b0049aaccd0f3e73aef90b684c4a8
Closes-Bug: #1623545
(cherry picked from commit b000989635be95a1548a983d290d16492b436571)

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-18 18:31:58.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/scheduler/client/test_report.py', 'nova/scheduler/client/report.py'], 'message': 'Correct wrong max_unit in placement inventory

When the resource tracker creates Inventory in the placement
API for its VCPU, MEMORY_MB and DISK_GB, max_unit is set to 1.

Until commit I18596a3c0f2b0049aaccd0f3e73aef90b684c4a8 the
min_unit,max_unit and step_size constraints on Inventory were
not being checked when making Allocations. When that
enforcement merges, the resource tracker will no longer be
able to make allocations of anything other than unit 1.

This patch tries to fix the above stated problem by changing
the value of max_unit to reflect the real limits on the machine
when creating the inventory.

Change-Id: I23fa868fec7f71c01e78e1a3bba5b08407c1e3ef
Closes-bug: #1638681
Co-Authored-By: Chris Dent <cdent@anticdent.org>
(cherry picked from commit 00bc0cb53d6113fae9a7714386953d1d75db71c1)
'}]
commit_message:
Correct wrong max_unit in placement inventory

When the resource tracker creates Inventory in the placement
API for its VCPU, MEMORY_MB and DISK_GB, max_unit is set to 1.

Until commit I18596a3c0f2b0049aaccd0f3e73aef90b684c4a8 the
min_unit,max_unit and step_size constraints on Inventory were
not being checked when making Allocations. When that
enforcement merges, the resource tracker will no longer be
able to make allocations of anything other than unit 1.

This patch tries to fix the above stated problem by changing
the value of max_unit to reflect the real limits on the machine
when creating the inventory.

Change-Id: I23fa868fec7f71c01e78e1a3bba5b08407c1e3ef
Closes-bug: #1638681
Co-Authored-By: Chris Dent <cdent@anticdent.org>
(cherry picked from commit 00bc0cb53d6113fae9a7714386953d1d75db71c1)

commit_message:
placement: genericize on resource providers

A simple patch that makes a number of the methods of the scheduler
report client just take a resource provider UUID and a set of inventory
records. With upcoming patches, the compute node is not the only
provider of resources in the system and we want to keep various report
client methods for adding resource provider and inventory records as
generic as possible instead of being specific to a compute node.

Conflicts:
        nova/scheduler/client/report.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having hacking change
4eb89c206e68a7172ebad897ad24769036c7bdd6 in stable/newton.

NOTE(mriedem): I've removed the blueprint reference from the commit
message on this change because while it was part of a series in Ocata,
it's a refactor patch which has no functional difference in how the
report client works and makes cherry-picking other changes on top of
this for actual bug fixes much simpler.

Change-Id: Ia8fe9d71893e8bf3f4f8cddd329613e269fef210

commit_message:
placement: refactor instance translate function

Makes the _allocations() object method of the SchedulerReportingClient
into a simple module-level function called
_instance_to_allocations_dict(). This makes the function name match what
the returned result is and indicates what the function actually does.

Change-Id: I0da4393fe884f626bb306a251472590535aab331
(cherry picked from commit a6cfc685dd3a16dccf491bf95522d4bcb38b3951)

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-18 18:31:58.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/scheduler/client/test_report.py', 'nova/scheduler/client/report.py'], 'message': "placement: refactor translate from node to dict

This patch refactors the previous object method on the scheduler report
client _compute_node_inventory() to being a module-level function called
_compute_node_to_inventory_dict(). The spurious top-level 'inventories'
key is removed from the returned dict and the payload for PUT
/r-p/{uuid}/inventories is constructed explicitly now.

Refactors the unit tests for the report client that handle inventory to
remove unnecessary mocking and correct some improper stub values that
were being masked by the mocks.

Change-Id: I70e5b649e59598b1fe356fa401769e8a7ce60c72
(cherry picked from commit 310e4dcbd8abe0d1bfab3d4dd0818c6a0630fc8a)
"}]
commit_message:
placement: refactor translate from node to dict

This patch refactors the previous object method on the scheduler report
client _compute_node_inventory() to being a module-level function called
_compute_node_to_inventory_dict(). The spurious top-level 'inventories'
key is removed from the returned dict and the payload for PUT
/r-p/{uuid}/inventories is constructed explicitly now.

Refactors the unit tests for the report client that handle inventory to
remove unnecessary mocking and correct some improper stub values that
were being masked by the mocks.

Change-Id: I70e5b649e59598b1fe356fa401769e8a7ce60c72
(cherry picked from commit 310e4dcbd8abe0d1bfab3d4dd0818c6a0630fc8a)

commit_message:
Apply tempest vars when running tempest

Tempest variables OS_TEST_TIMEOUT and TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY from grenaderc
are not applied as variable are not exported.
Export OS_TEST_TIMEOUT and TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY if it is
set before running tempest tests.

Change-Id: I66a81f31c8658d3cdbb18787d39a90bb1e6939f3

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-02 18:23:37.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': '[Manila] Add proper skip filters for special manila tempest jobs

Manila has 2 tempest jobs that run always, because their names
do not satisfy common filter for tempest job namings.
So, add 2 appropriate filters for 2 special manila jobs so they will
run when really needed, not always.

Change-Id: I6f1cde926cb3e4c05e8885e087ea574d72282ea1
'}]
commit_message:
[Manila] Add proper skip filters for special manila tempest jobs

Manila has 2 tempest jobs that run always, because their names
do not satisfy common filter for tempest job namings.
So, add 2 appropriate filters for 2 special manila jobs so they will
run when really needed, not always.

Change-Id: I6f1cde926cb3e4c05e8885e087ea574d72282ea1

Previously, we were creating the symlink for default
deployment graph without unlinking it. This creates
second symlink within /etc/fuel/graphs/deploy
directory

Rename deploy graph to `default` to comply with plugins

Change-Id: I0769dc84c38759aab6ef9288c00fb2dda40add7f
Closes-bug: #1670182
'}]
commit_message:
Make tasks upload on package upgrade idempotent

Previously, we were creating the symlink for default
deployment graph without unlinking it. This creates
second symlink within /etc/fuel/graphs/deploy
directory

Rename deploy graph to `default` to comply with plugins

Change-Id: I0769dc84c38759aab6ef9288c00fb2dda40add7f
Closes-bug: #1670182

commit_message:
Add Docker Registry profile

The profile was moved out of instack-undercloud puppet manifest and
changed to install a v2 Docker registry rather than the old, deprecated
v1 registry.

Related BZ: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1428826

Change-Id: Iecf7a4c7e86349e6ecaa0a8ee6d37223e3af7862
(cherry picked from commit a21f1a193a7076a335d82f47cab04340da9c93ff)

commit_message:
Set keystone::endpoint::version explicitly

Upstream patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/438061/
deprecates keystone::endpoint::version in order to create
versionless keystone endpoints. Fuel ostf are not ready, that's
why keystone::endpoint::version should be set explicitly
to work around this problem.

Change-Id: If7713b6c3e78f64bdeb29dfeebce24a24b4c364b

commit_message:
Ensure we install setuptools from requirements

Use pip_install_gr so we get the version pinned by requirements.  The
depends-on is an example of where we're trying to pin to workaround
issues.

subject: Truncate lock-id when it is not using uuid
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-04 05:01:34.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/db/neutron/lockedobjects_db.py'], 'message': 'Truncate lock-id when it is not using uuid

The lock-id model sets the string of 36 chars.
When using hostname as lock-id, it may be longer than that.
We have to truncate it to the maximum number of chars.

The check of lock-id is fully tested by fullstack.
Because it needs the correct ml2 parameters.

Change-Id: I52511c2c46e955964de2ffea14bc85b933f4d4c4
'}]
commit_message:
Truncate lock-id when it is not using uuid

The lock-id model sets the string of 36 chars.
When using hostname as lock-id, it may be longer than that.
We have to truncate it to the maximum number of chars.

The check of lock-id is fully tested by fullstack.
Because it needs the correct ml2 parameters.

Change-Id: I52511c2c46e955964de2ffea14bc85b933f4d4c4

subject: Fix the regression issues of [1]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-03 06:56:15.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/controller/df_base_app.py', 'dragonflow/controller/l3_app_base.py'], 'message': 'Fix the regression issues of [1]

[1] delete dragonflow.controller.df_db_notifier, which has a default
empty implementation of add_local_port and add_remote_port. Without
the default methods, update_local_port and update remote_port will
get AttributeError.

[1] also copy a wrong use of _delete_router_port.

This patch fixes the two issues together, as they stems from same place.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/436410/

Change-Id: Iaad580727b80958d545c8f19c868e9a37434e4de
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the regression issues of [1]

[1] delete dragonflow.controller.df_db_notifier, which has a default
empty implementation of add_local_port and add_remote_port. Without
the default methods, update_local_port and update remote_port will
get AttributeError.

[1] also copy a wrong use of _delete_router_port.

This patch fixes the two issues together, as they stems from same place.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/436410/

Change-Id: Iaad580727b80958d545c8f19c868e9a37434e4de

commit_message:
Deprecate meter_dispatcher and event_dispatcher options

1) meter_dispatcher and event_dispatcher options are now deprecated,
please use meter_dispatchers and event_dispatchers options instead.
2) Switch meter_dispatchers and event_dispatchers parameters to
$::os_service_default fact.

Change-Id: I32dcbf34160906d15c871272e5ce0eba46c02b5e
Closes-Bug: #1668817

subject: Add a policy section to the Mistral specs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-02 11:31:59.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/index.rst', 'specs/policy-template.rst'], 'message': "Add a policy section to the Mistral specs

The idea of policies is to document something related to the project
that isn't tied to a specific release and often isn't related to code.
For example, a policy could be related to how we organise or how we
agree to do code reviews.

This process is inspired by the policies used in TripleO and the policy
template is a direct copy of the one used in TripleO.

Change-Id: I05f5076a1559790bf6d0f7b68d528748a2acd20b
"}]
commit_message:
Add a policy section to the Mistral specs

The idea of policies is to document something related to the project
that isn't tied to a specific release and often isn't related to code.
For example, a policy could be related to how we organise or how we
agree to do code reviews.

This process is inspired by the policies used in TripleO and the policy
template is a direct copy of the one used in TripleO.

Change-Id: I05f5076a1559790bf6d0f7b68d528748a2acd20b

subject: libvirt: Remove redundant bdm serial mangling and saving during swap_volume
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-09 13:37:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: Remove redundant bdm serial mangling and saving during swap_volume

During an initial swap_volume call the serial of the original volume was
previously stashed in the connection_info of the new volume by the
compute layer. This was used by I19d5182d11 to allow the virt driver to
lookup and update the existing BDM with the new volume's connection_info
after it had been used by connect_volume.

Future calls to swap_volume in the compute layer would not
update the serial found in the old volume connection_info. This would
result in an invalid serial being copied into the new volume
connection_info and used to preform a lookup of a BDM that didn't exist.

To correct this we now explicitly set the serial of the new volume to
that of the new volume id. While the correct serial id should already be
present in the connection_info provided by most backend Cinder volume
drivers the act of updating this dict is required by our own functional
tests to invoke a failure case :

https://git.io/vDmRE

The serial is updated once more to match the volume id returned
by os-migrate-volume-completion prior to the BDM being updated in the
compute layer.

The BDM lookup and save from the virt layer is also removed as the
compute layer retains a reference to new_cinfo and will update the BDM
with this, including any modifications, at the end of swap_volume.

Finally, the associated Tempest admin test is also extended by the
following change to now attempt a second volume swap to verify these
changes :

I2a2c80a164b9f75d0e7e0503a24194bedfc0e66b

Closes-bug: #1661016
Change-Id: If74dd9d8e7191047b6f1cd7e35b6fc667f004f91
(cherry picked from commit 1bf7ac804808eb0d4a68847e466f5fa7d1dcd55e)
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Remove redundant bdm serial mangling and saving during swap_volume

During an initial swap_volume call the serial of the original volume was
previously stashed in the connection_info of the new volume by the
compute layer. This was used by I19d5182d11 to allow the virt driver to
lookup and update the existing BDM with the new volume's connection_info
after it had been used by connect_volume.

Future calls to swap_volume in the compute layer would not
update the serial found in the old volume connection_info. This would
result in an invalid serial being copied into the new volume
connection_info and used to preform a lookup of a BDM that didn't exist.

To correct this we now explicitly set the serial of the new volume to
that of the new volume id. While the correct serial id should already be
present in the connection_info provided by most backend Cinder volume
drivers the act of updating this dict is required by our own functional
tests to invoke a failure case :

https://git.io/vDmRE

The serial is updated once more to match the volume id returned
by os-migrate-volume-completion prior to the BDM being updated in the
compute layer.

The BDM lookup and save from the virt layer is also removed as the
compute layer retains a reference to new_cinfo and will update the BDM
with this, including any modifications, at the end of swap_volume.

Finally, the associated Tempest admin test is also extended by the
following change to now attempt a second volume swap to verify these
changes :

I2a2c80a164b9f75d0e7e0503a24194bedfc0e66b

Closes-bug: #1661016
Change-Id: If74dd9d8e7191047b6f1cd7e35b6fc667f004f91
(cherry picked from commit 1bf7ac804808eb0d4a68847e466f5fa7d1dcd55e)

commit_message:
Put docker puppet config in puppet_config dict

This approach removes the need for the yaql zip to build the
docker-puppet data by building the data in a puppet_config dict.

This allows a future change to make docker-puppet.py only accept dict
data.

Currently the step_config is left where it is and referenced inside
puppet_config, but feedback is welcome whether this is necessary or
desirable.

Change-Id: I4a4d7a6fd2735cb841174af305dbb62e0b3d3e8c

commit_message:
Add ovsdbapp project

The ovsdb api code from Neutron is used in at least 4 other projects,
so it makes sense to move it into its own project. neutron_lib isn't a
good fit because this code depends on Python code from the OVS project
and users of neutron_lib shouldn't be forced to install OVS.

Change-Id: Idf3dcca7e94fad49725fa427fbf874c674fdfd6a
Depends-On: Icd9be59f8c4e41801e30734d332c572e08680087

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-04 15:24:01.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py'], 'message': "Filter on Active status in SolidFire List

This just adds a filter on Active status when doing a call
to SolidFire's ListVolumesForAccount API.

This will help eliminate a number of potential issues with
incorrectly marking deleted or inactive volumes that may have
been part of a cleanup action from being discovered and listed
as duplicate volume records.

Change-Id: Ifc67857970d99943a03330773918971b33a8e407
Closes-Bug: #1668772
"}]
commit_message:
Filter on Active status in SolidFire List

This just adds a filter on Active status when doing a call
to SolidFire's ListVolumesForAccount API.

This will help eliminate a number of potential issues with
incorrectly marking deleted or inactive volumes that may have
been part of a cleanup action from being discovered and listed
as duplicate volume records.

Change-Id: Ifc67857970d99943a03330773918971b33a8e407
Closes-Bug: #1668772

commit_message:
Add ovsdbapp project

The ovsdb api code in Neutron is used by at least 4 other projects,
so it makes sense to split the code out to its own project. The
neutron_lib project is not a good fit since this code relies on
the Python code from the OVS project and users of neutron_lib
should not be forced to install OVS.

Needed-By: Idf3dcca7e94fad49725fa427fbf874c674fdfd6a
Change-Id: Icd9be59f8c4e41801e30734d332c572e08680087

The job has been stable for a while now and we also

commit_message:
Turn on voting for Nova tox-functional-py35 job

The job has been stable for a while now and we also
have the tests-py3.txt blacklist if we need. So let's
make the job voting from now on. This helps with the
Pike goal as well. Since this job is voting, we need
the job to be in the gate queue as well.

Change-Id: Ib7b8d8eff74f891d257b2ed5b4d35282b32b8694

commit_message:
Fix verify_srv_deleted and is_srv_deleted methods

Comparison with id is better than object comparison. Also get_instance_detail
prints NotFound error to log when instance is already deleted.

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-03 15:48:42.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/services/test_trigger_service.py', 'mistral/services/triggers.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_cron_trigger.py'], 'message': "Fix get_next_execution_time

get_next_execution_time was incorrectly modifying it's return value
based on a conversion from localtime to UTC. However, this function
should not be doing such a conversion. It could result in multiplying
a TZ error. Croniter doesn't care about TZ. It just applies a pattern
to a given start time; therefore, it should be up to the caller to
pass the proper time.

Also, start_time is now based on utcnow() instead of localtime now().

Change-Id: Ifbd63d9e1f56085928bede22ce4f2954e1b38991
Partial-Bug: #1654218
"}]
commit_message:
Fix get_next_execution_time

get_next_execution_time was incorrectly modifying it's return value
based on a conversion from localtime to UTC. However, this function
should not be doing such a conversion. It could result in multiplying
a TZ error. Croniter doesn't care about TZ. It just applies a pattern
to a given start time; therefore, it should be up to the caller to
pass the proper time.

Also, start_time is now based on utcnow() instead of localtime now().

Change-Id: Ifbd63d9e1f56085928bede22ce4f2954e1b38991
Partial-Bug: #1654218

subject: Use utcnow() in expired executions policy test

This test fails if the TZ of the execution environment is not UTC. Using

the DB. The DB stores timestamps in UTC.

Change-Id: I70af0d8009b5fa35777961ed3189a80ddcee28b1
Partial-Bug: #1654218
'}]
commit_message:
Use utcnow() in expired executions policy test

This test fails if the TZ of the execution environment is not UTC. Using
utcnow() ensures that the tested values are the same as what comes from
the DB. The DB stores timestamps in UTC.

Change-Id: I70af0d8009b5fa35777961ed3189a80ddcee28b1
Partial-Bug: #1654218

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-03 11:52:36.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/actions/openstack/test_generator.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/base.py', 'mistral/tests/resources/openstack/test_mapping.json'], 'message': "Every unit test creates and registers every OpenStack action

That means around 1300 database inserts (or, attempted inserts, some seem to
fail) before every test. This is very slow. Only one of the tests
actually verifies the OpenStack actions are registered.

Recently I5ab01395c507fc857dca7cf08ab344a07def0dcf gave us a way to set
a different mapping file in the config. This change makes every test use
the much smaller test mapping file, rather than the default file.

Given that one test is checking specific actions being registered, these
were added to the test file to make that test pass. Once the OpenStack actions
are moved to mistral-extra this will improve again. The tempest tests
verify the actions load and tests a number of the OpenStack actions directly,
so our coverage of them isn't reduced.

From a brief test on my laptop, this reduces the unit test run time by
between 60 and 90 seconds.

Related-Bug: #1669511
Change-Id: Icc4ec5ef7d93d5ebb64f21c62d0bf7fc91e2f084
"}]
commit_message:
Every unit test creates and registers every OpenStack action

That means around 1300 database inserts (or, attempted inserts, some seem to
fail) before every test. This is very slow. Only one of the tests
actually verifies the OpenStack actions are registered.

Recently I5ab01395c507fc857dca7cf08ab344a07def0dcf gave us a way to set
a different mapping file in the config. This change makes every test use
the much smaller test mapping file, rather than the default file.

Given that one test is checking specific actions being registered, these
were added to the test file to make that test pass. Once the OpenStack actions
are moved to mistral-extra this will improve again. The tempest tests
verify the actions load and tests a number of the OpenStack actions directly,
so our coverage of them isn't reduced.

From a brief test on my laptop, this reduces the unit test run time by
between 60 and 90 seconds.

Related-Bug: #1669511
Change-Id: Icc4ec5ef7d93d5ebb64f21c62d0bf7fc91e2f084

subject: Reduce the number of with-items and retried in the concurrency test
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-03 10:20:17.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_with_items.py'], 'message': "Reduce the number of with-items and retried in the concurrency test

Each additional with-item value and retry added an extra second to test
test run but having this many didn't add any value. Reducing the number
but still making sure retries are exercised reduced the test time by
around 50%.

Related-Bug: #1669511
Change-Id: Ibc25bfad2d213a31a022ea59d8c2d1a36f2d75d7
"}]
commit_message:
Reduce the number of with-items and retried in the concurrency test

Each additional with-item value and retry added an extra second to test
test run but having this many didn't add any value. Reducing the number
but still making sure retries are exercised reduced the test time by
around 50%.

Related-Bug: #1669511
Change-Id: Ibc25bfad2d213a31a022ea59d8c2d1a36f2d75d7

commit_message:
add tripleo non-voting job into neutron & neutronclient gates

With the motivation of adding more diversity in how do we test
neutron & neutronclient, this patch will add a tripleo job,
non-voting.

The idea is to bring more feedback when testing patches in these
projects and detect what failures we could have outside devstack.

The jobs are not voting. We don't expect Neutron team to open TripleO job
logs. The idea is to let TripleO folks know when a job is red so they
can investigate and tell if something critical is broken in the patch.

Change-Id: Ia60812b7b7ac5cb19d5707ffb5130e804c36a001

subject: Add Tricircle multi-region job
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2017-02-28 09:23:04.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/tricircle.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Add Tricircle multi-region job

Tricircle is to provide networking automation across Neutron in
multi-region OpenStack deployments. Currently the function test
job in Tricircle can only work in single region, and most of
the multi-region test cases are not able to be executed.

It's time to add one non-voting multi-region gate/check test
job in Tricircle. The multi-region devstack-gate environment
will be configured in the pre_test_hook.sh in
another patch to Tricircle project
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/438382/)

The Tricircle devstack plugin has already been updated to
support such a multi-region job.

Change-Id: Ie7c7a1475c104c78453e785f8729bc1025f530fc
Signed-off-by: joehuang <joehuang@huawei.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add Tricircle multi-region job

Tricircle is to provide networking automation across Neutron in
multi-region OpenStack deployments. Currently the function test
job in Tricircle can only work in single region, and most of
the multi-region test cases are not able to be executed.

It's time to add one non-voting multi-region gate/check test
job in Tricircle. The multi-region devstack-gate environment
will be configured in the pre_test_hook.sh in
another patch to Tricircle project
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/438382/)

The Tricircle devstack plugin has already been updated to
support such a multi-region job.

Change-Id: Ie7c7a1475c104c78453e785f8729bc1025f530fc
Signed-off-by: joehuang <joehuang@huawei.com>

commit_message:
Enable nailgun debug mode after fuel installation

For now "DEBUG: true" does not affects nailgun's development mode
which makes harded to debug backend errors like 400. Enabling debug allow
us to see hidden errors.

Change-Id: I4d58aaf31426f194ced2d54309893b83a102674f

subject: Rework nailgun restarting spike
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-03 13:05:51.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/helpers/fuel_actions.py'], 'message': "Rework nailgun restarting spike

Previous 502 error right after nailgun restart was uWSGI response
for request to not fully started nailgun, so previous sleep(10) solution
actually fixes the issue allowing nailgun to start properly.
But sleep(10) is not good solution at all in production so
lets use fuel's built-in client that can wait untill nailgun service
will response good data instead of returning 5xx errors.

Change-Id: I4e400b682d4cc69b994cb06d0cf12b27e0f6fff2
"}]
commit_message:
Rework nailgun restarting spike

Previous 502 error right after nailgun restart was uWSGI response
for request to not fully started nailgun, so previous sleep(10) solution
actually fixes the issue allowing nailgun to start properly.
But sleep(10) is not good solution at all in production so
lets use fuel's built-in client that can wait untill nailgun service
will response good data instead of returning 5xx errors.

Change-Id: I4e400b682d4cc69b994cb06d0cf12b27e0f6fff2

subject: The file system based bank implementation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-05 14:17:43.000000000', 'files': ['karbor/services/protection/bank_plugins/file_system_bank_plugin.py', 'karbor/tests/unit/protection/test_file_system_bank_plugin.py'], 'message': 'The file system based bank implementation

Currently we only suppport Swift as a bank implementation. This means
that anyone that uses Karbor must also install Swift. This might be
unacceptable or over complicated for some deployments.

I suggest adding an FS based implementation. It will use files for
objects storing objects and object metadata.

Change-Id: Ia9c0c76b5fd3063cdd16e7a4b512eb996d9e19e2
Implements: blueprint file-system-bank
'}]
commit_message:
The file system based bank implementation

Currently we only suppport Swift as a bank implementation. This means
that anyone that uses Karbor must also install Swift. This might be
unacceptable or over complicated for some deployments.

I suggest adding an FS based implementation. It will use files for
objects storing objects and object metadata.

Change-Id: Ia9c0c76b5fd3063cdd16e7a4b512eb996d9e19e2
Implements: blueprint file-system-bank

commit_message:
Change resource_types action

Change resource_types action for purge so that when developer use
the zaqar client lib, the parameter 'resource_types' can be passed
in an array instead of a string. It makes more sense and be
consistent with the API.

Change-Id: Idbf514d76219548c0dbfbcf96fe931c681276443

commit_message:
[POC][placement] Import os_traits library

Import os_traits library from https://github.com/jaypipes/os-traits, so
that we can also iterate on the implementation of the library.

Changes for original code:
* Add 'CUSTOM_' to the namespaces for user-defined trait.
* Use capitals for trait name. It is for using same valid character set
  with ResourceClass.

Partial implement blueprint resource-provider-tags

Change-Id: I8e7bee3302ba854aeb8de468a3802d442dc82787

commit_message:
[config-reference] Cleanup ibm storwize

The Storwize driver includes a hand-written table with configuration
options that duplicated the autogenerated one. Remove the hand-written
table.

Also fix missing "." in list.

Change-Id: Id3955407ab63b7416181f46660932d0ff9a3a617
Related-Bug: #1662922

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-03-03 22:00:59.000000000', 'files': ['openstackdocstheme/__init__.py', 'openstackdocstheme/theme/openstackdocs_pdf/pdftheme.sty', 'openstackdocstheme/theme/openstackdocs_pdf/openstack-logo-full.png'], 'message': 'Adds LaTeX style file for building PDF documents

openstack-manuals now supports to build PDF documents
using Sphinx and pdflatex. To make more fancy PDFs,
separating LaTeX style definitions into one unified style file
and managing within openstackdocstheme is a good idea.

To apply styles to PDF documents,
reading the style file and assigning preamble in conf.py is needed.

Change-Id: I423675ff79827966e789df70b0f970ac2a10da50
Implements: blueprint build-pdf-from-rst-guides
Co-Authored-By: Ian Y. Choi <ianyrchoi@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Adds LaTeX style file for building PDF documents

openstack-manuals now supports to build PDF documents
using Sphinx and pdflatex. To make more fancy PDFs,
separating LaTeX style definitions into one unified style file
and managing within openstackdocstheme is a good idea.

To apply styles to PDF documents,
reading the style file and assigning preamble in conf.py is needed.

Change-Id: I423675ff79827966e789df70b0f970ac2a10da50
Implements: blueprint build-pdf-from-rst-guides
Co-Authored-By: Ian Y. Choi <ianyrchoi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Disable partition preservation tests

https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1634691 shows that partition
preservation feature works on magic and shouldn't save partition
in current implementation (it relates on an another bug).

Change-Id: I2ea5f1b9f1db07a40f1f48346d6836ef96a07da9
Partial-bug:1656040

subject: Cap networking-bagpipe to Newton
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-01 22:30:43.000000000', 'files': ['upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Cap networking-bagpipe to Newton

Without an upper bound on the dependency networking-bgpvpn draws
networking-bagpipe 6.0.0, which targets Ocata and breaks with Newton.

Change-Id: I76ed1b5918638419a010ea6e3d35f8690ada9256
'}]
commit_message:
Cap networking-bagpipe to Newton

Without an upper bound on the dependency networking-bgpvpn draws
networking-bagpipe 6.0.0, which targets Ocata and breaks with Newton.

Change-Id: I76ed1b5918638419a010ea6e3d35f8690ada9256

Since commit 7aa3d9ff9c775a44496b0f3e949a8ff84edc1881, the resources

remove the related commands and tests on the neutron client side.

commit_message:
Remove lbaas v1 commands and related tests

Since commit 7aa3d9ff9c775a44496b0f3e949a8ff84edc1881, the resources
including pool, vip, member, healthmonitor has been droped. We should
remove the related commands and tests on the neutron client side.

Change-Id: I6506352ab44b43775102cccbed8b0cd5aded6674

subject: Change filter name in DevStack plugin
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-03-06 01:26:21.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Change filter name in DevStack plugin

The Blazar-specific Nova scheduler filter is automatically enabled by
the DevStack installation script. This patch changes the filter name
from ClimateFilter to BlazarFilter.

Change-Id: I63698f6aa9a9785c7e14b599d8a930a4b369d429
'}]
commit_message:
Change filter name in DevStack plugin

The Blazar-specific Nova scheduler filter is automatically enabled by
the DevStack installation script. This patch changes the filter name
from ClimateFilter to BlazarFilter.

Change-Id: I63698f6aa9a9785c7e14b599d8a930a4b369d429

subject: Fix api-ref building with sphinx 1.5
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-05 07:22:53.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/v3-ext/oauth.inc'], 'message': 'Fix api-ref building with sphinx 1.5

Sphinx 1.5 complains about "Could not lex literal_block as "json".
Highlighting skipped." - and fails to build.

Change the problematic code to use javascript for highlighting - it's
only a json snippet, not a full json file.

Change-Id: I65558119dcc166bd25f12568b480498cac80c653
'}]
commit_message:
Fix api-ref building with sphinx 1.5

Sphinx 1.5 complains about "Could not lex literal_block as "json".
Highlighting skipped." - and fails to build.

Change the problematic code to use javascript for highlighting - it's
only a json snippet, not a full json file.

Change-Id: I65558119dcc166bd25f12568b480498cac80c653

subject: Fix install_libvirt for other RHEL-based distros
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-02 11:19:53.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova_plugins/functions-libvirt'], 'message': 'Fix install_libvirt for other RHEL-based distros

Since https://review.openstack.org/#/c/438325 landed
it only works for Centos 7, but not for other
RHEL-based distributions: Virtuozzo and, probably, RHEV.

Both of above have own version for qemu-kvm package: qemu-kvm-vz and qemu-kvm-rhev,
accordingly. These packages provide "qemu-kvm", like qemu-kvm-ev,
and, when you call "yum install qemu-kvm", they replace the default OS package.

Change-Id: I46da627c0da8925064862fdc283db81591979285
'}]
commit_message:
Fix install_libvirt for other RHEL-based distros

Since https://review.openstack.org/#/c/438325 landed
it only works for Centos 7, but not for other
RHEL-based distributions: Virtuozzo and, probably, RHEV.

Both of above have own version for qemu-kvm package: qemu-kvm-vz and qemu-kvm-rhev,
accordingly. These packages provide "qemu-kvm", like qemu-kvm-ev,
and, when you call "yum install qemu-kvm", they replace the default OS package.

Change-Id: I46da627c0da8925064862fdc283db81591979285

commit_message:
AgentListener initialization was fixed

When Murano Agent is disabled AgentListener was not
initialized properly which caused deployment errors.

This is partial backport of the
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/387993/. That commit
was supposed to fix tests that do not exist in Murano Newton
and thus wasn't backported.

Change-Id: I1a9f61c6b0020c6d3a5812f4d8ed519dc3cb7b44
Closes-Bug: #1669903
Related-bug: #1634483

subject: Make shared image text less confusing for Glance v2
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-02 12:35:38.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/images.service.js', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/images.service.spec.js', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/filters/image-visibility.filter.spec.js', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/filters/image-visibility.filter.js', 'releasenotes/notes/glance-v2-ba86ba34611f95ce.yaml'], 'message': 'Make shared image text less confusing for Glance v2

When using Glance v2 and logged in as an admin, the images
panel now shows all the images in the cloud. This is the
way the Glance v2 list api works, but it changed the behavior
from v1. In Horizon, we can't tell whether non-public images
that aren't owned by current project are shared or just from
some other project without making multiple api calls. This
patch makes the text of the images less confusing when using
Glance v2, so that it no longer claims the images are "Shared
with Project".

Change-Id: I2859e104de78a6a633b0e1a2ff30dde674b4bdee
Closes-Bug: #1624743
(cherry picked from commit b01bf0f9a16b6aa48f73bf046e9ef51287cb40cc)

commit_message:
Make shared image text less confusing for Glance v2

When using Glance v2 and logged in as an admin, the images
panel now shows all the images in the cloud. This is the
way the Glance v2 list api works, but it changed the behavior
from v1. In Horizon, we can't tell whether non-public images
that aren't owned by current project are shared or just from
some other project without making multiple api calls. This
patch makes the text of the images less confusing when using
Glance v2, so that it no longer claims the images are "Shared
with Project".

Change-Id: I2859e104de78a6a633b0e1a2ff30dde674b4bdee
Closes-Bug: #1624743
(cherry picked from commit b01bf0f9a16b6aa48f73bf046e9ef51287cb40cc)

commit_message:
Only get detailed info for Nova servers when necessary

Horizon will get all servers from Nova in different several places,
but sometimes it only need ID and name instead of all the related
information of servers. novaclient already support 'detailed=False'
param for servers query.

Horizon page loading performance can also be improved with this patch.

Closes-Bug: #1661423
Change-Id: Ic4cc95cb4eaed0461a22ab1045fa83ba5a5e9ce4
(cherry picked from commit c33b0840cbb0f0c29c9e12f56d986c2740d8f9c8)

commit_message:
hyperv: make sure to plug OVS VIFs after resize/migrate

Since the network_info wasn't getting passed to vmops.power_on
after a resize/cold migrate confirmation, the OVS VIFs weren't
getting plugged.

Change-Id: Ia9b7dc11cd74ba896a7254c16a95b7a834a28475
Closes-Bug: #1657424
(cherry picked from commit 568a682e5efa6e4fd49b69e02cbd80f1d8a96c63)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-03 22:08:09.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/notifiers/nova.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/notifiers/test_nova.py'], 'message': "Bump to Nova V2.1

Nova V2.1 API has been available since Kilo, and the API is CURRENT.
Neutron is using Nova API via novaclient and the used Nova API is
V2.1 on the gate as the default Nova endpoint. So this patch doesn't
change the used Nova API actually, but current novaclient skips checking
expected API version in a response from Nova API.
This patch will be helpful to avoid an issue when enabling this check

NOTE: Cinder is using Nova v2.1 API with the similar patch as

Change-Id: Ie3a10f7078f4213da77be522e3866f82b5e8683c
"}]
commit_message:
Bump to Nova V2.1

Nova V2.1 API has been available since Kilo, and the API is CURRENT.
Neutron is using Nova API via novaclient and the used Nova API is
V2.1 on the gate as the default Nova endpoint. So this patch doesn't
change the used Nova API actually, but current novaclient skips checking
expected API version in a response from Nova API.
This patch will be helpful to avoid an issue when enabling this check
on novaclient side.

NOTE: Cinder is using Nova v2.1 API with the similar patch as
      Iadd3363265be6c5a8ed46704a712da6c15e2b046

Change-Id: Ie3a10f7078f4213da77be522e3866f82b5e8683c

commit_message:
Change default of auth_version to v3

Keystone v3 API is CURRENT and the v2 API is deprecated now.
So we need to change the default config of auth_version to fit for
current API status.

NOTE: Devstack changes this config to "v2" when enabling the v2 API.
      So we will still test the v2 API on the gate until we will
      change Devstack (I801e6740258ddea2a1b628a209970e0307d39d12)

Change-Id: Id5e5ed9bf4f8b0f9eb376bfc7c5801f0956da1d9

commit_message:
The background colour of the success message changed

When the password is successfully changed, the background colour
of the success message is changed from red to green to avoid
users mistaking it for an error message.

Change-Id: Icbaae9f15d02368539e47cd5e929c19ed67b5fed
Closes-Bug: #1520486

subject: Use utf-8 to replace default codec in _filter_list
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-01 10:41:34.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test__utils.py', 'shade/_utils.py'], 'message': "Use utf-8 to replace default codec in _filter_list

If the default codec is 'ascii', and there are unicode characters
in the list element, shade will failed due to UnicodeEncodeError
exception. Change the codec to utf-8 to fix this.

Closes-Bug: 1668849

Change-Id: I546b1fbd3375861173f411a7cfdb9e1baa5e6250
Signed-off-by: Liu Qing <liuqing@chinac.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Use utf-8 to replace default codec in _filter_list

If the default codec is 'ascii', and there are unicode characters
in the list element, shade will failed due to UnicodeEncodeError
exception. Change the codec to utf-8 to fix this.

Closes-Bug: 1668849

Change-Id: I546b1fbd3375861173f411a7cfdb9e1baa5e6250
Signed-off-by: Liu Qing <liuqing@chinac.com>

subject: Change the base class of osc.v1.DeleteHost
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-24 08:27:35.000000000', 'files': ['masakariclient/osc/v1/host.py'], 'message': "Change the base class of osc.v1.DeleteHost

Since the function to delete a segment host doesn't output
resources after processing, the base class of DeleteHost class
should be the osc_lib.command.command.Command class.
This patch modified the base class of DeleteHost class and
modified so that it doesn't return an unnecessary value.

Change-Id: I2fcce95ae25be94ee5c38b876574476b77fdedff
Closes-Bug: #1656762
"}]
commit_message:
Change the base class of osc.v1.DeleteHost

Since the function to delete a segment host doesn't output
resources after processing, the base class of DeleteHost class
should be the osc_lib.command.command.Command class.
This patch modified the base class of DeleteHost class and
modified so that it doesn't return an unnecessary value.

Change-Id: I2fcce95ae25be94ee5c38b876574476b77fdedff
Closes-Bug: #1656762

commit_message:

in a follow-up path.

commit_message:
prepare to use reno from Pike onwards

A stated goal from the Atlanta PTG this week was to use reno for our
release notes from Pike onwards.  This requires reno to support
configurable sections, which have been added by:

    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/436639

Once this is merged into reno, this commit configures openstack-manuals
so that reno will work with it, and a build of releasenotes/ will
automatically include a reno-generated report via reno's sphinx
extension.

Depends-on: I914572c6a07ca81c54965b4b5a6b6aba50b3a787
Change-Id: Id029f462fb553b3429629b90585e2790734f1bb9

subject: Fixed the file I/O issues on archive api
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-04 22:08:07.000000000', 'files': ['zun/container/docker/driver.py', 'zun/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_containers.py', 'zun/api/controllers/v1/containers.py'], 'message': "Fixed the file I/O issues on archive api

This commit is addressing the outstanding comments of:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/421132/

On get_archive, read raw file data from the returned stream
before returning it. Otherwise, the client won't receive the file
data. On put_archive, assume the inputted parameter is the filedata
and directly pass it to docker.

Change-Id: Ica2ff8d89097228213bcc2c1189f2b05619b4728
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed the file I/O issues on archive api

This commit is addressing the outstanding comments of:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/421132/

On get_archive, read raw file data from the returned stream
before returning it. Otherwise, the client won't receive the file
data. On put_archive, assume the inputted parameter is the filedata
and directly pass it to docker.

Change-Id: Ica2ff8d89097228213bcc2c1189f2b05619b4728

commit_message:
Revert "Ship YAML file to /usr/share"

It is a terrible experience if I want to modify any parameter of
pipeline definition such as publisher, sink that I have to cd to
"/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/ceilometer/pipeline/data"
firstly, and then modify the yaml files.

This reverts commit d9c11bb0abf15de1487a287bdcdf42c6ffb2d94d.

Change-Id: I698094d687386d01f663d20e2e71cec9965c4751

Add DbStore2 member to DFlowApp

Several new apps are going to use DbStore to access new models,
additionally, once we start porting the legacy models we'll have to

subject: lb_policy support NODE_RECOVER(2)
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-03-05 07:36:34.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/tests/unit/policies/test_lb_policy.py', 'senlin/policies/lb_policy.py'], 'message': 'lb_policy support NODE_RECOVER(2)

This patch adds support to post_op(...) to support NODE_RECOVER action.

There are 2 concerns why I move the support to lb policy from cluster
action layer to node action layer.

1.)Concurrency:  node action are being excuted with mult threads, will
reduce the delay if we do add_member()/remove_member().

2.)Sync: The resources' status are synchronized in node action layer,
may execute unnecessary action since the real status of the resource is
"RUNNING"/"ACTIVE".

Change-Id: Ifce181d1f6fdd93b5ecc258d2b3d871065884eb1
'}]
commit_message:
lb_policy support NODE_RECOVER(2)

This patch adds support to post_op(...) to support NODE_RECOVER action.

There are 2 concerns why I move the support to lb policy from cluster
action layer to node action layer.

1.)Concurrency:  node action are being excuted with mult threads, will
reduce the delay if we do add_member()/remove_member().

2.)Sync: The resources' status are synchronized in node action layer,
may execute unnecessary action since the real status of the resource is
"RUNNING"/"ACTIVE".

Change-Id: Ifce181d1f6fdd93b5ecc258d2b3d871065884eb1

commit_message:
Add cleanup for all of a resource

Add into the CLI the ability to cleanup an entire resource.
This will help when you need to cleanup all of a particular
resource in your environment.

To delete all configmaps run:
   kolla-kubernetes resource delete configmap all

Change-Id: Ia6149303230b131bf19b81206b97ecc36b3ee616

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2017-01-31 15:42:50.000000000', 'files': ['muranoclient/osc/v1/deployment.py', 'muranoclient/tests/unit/osc/v1/test_deployment.py', 'muranoclient/v1/deployments.py', 'muranoclient/v1/shell.py', 'muranoclient/tests/unit/test_shell.py', 'muranoclient/tests/unit/test_methods.py'], 'message': 'Allows fetching of deployments from all environments.

Murano Dashboard uses Murano Client to fetch data from Murano.
In order to improve log browsing for deployments in Murano
Dashboard, which requires showing all deployments for all

commit_message:
Allows fetching of deployments from all environments.

Murano Dashboard uses Murano Client to fetch data from Murano.
In order to improve log browsing for deployments in Murano
Dashboard, which requires showing all deployments for all
environments, the deployments API had to be changed to support
this.

Includes client support for OSC as well as old murano client.

Change-Id: I80c02a8cfd82260f097474bb512f693aa6734655
Partially-implements: blueprint improve-deployment-log-browsing
Depends-On: I1b6a313af1a0c4aa57bd4e6f51da92b396b35165

commit_message:
Migrate climate namespace to blazar

Although the Climate project was renamed to Blazar in 2014, the code has
still been using the climate namespace.

This patch moves all code to the blazar directory and allows users and
operators to use the 'blazar' command namespace. The 'climate' namespace
remains O release to allow users of Blazar time to move their own
code to the blazar namespace, but will be removed in P release
development cycle.

Change-Id: Icbe6fab1051aae4ac819982a1fa4f323cb0bf2d0
Partial-Bug: #1662734

revisions:

With pbr 2.0 and Sphinx 1.5, the setting for treat sphinx warnings as
errors is setting warning-is-error in build_sphinx section. Migrate
the setting from the old warnerrors one.

Fix also problems found:
* code-blocks that could not be parsed
* Usage of :option: without declaring the option.
* Add blank lines to properly end markup.
* Fix a typo.
* Fix wrong markup of docstring
* Fix title underlinings.

Change-Id: I69ddde706a04f26bfccda072822dc0d230cb330e
'}]
commit_message:
Use Sphinx 1.5 warning-is-error

With pbr 2.0 and Sphinx 1.5, the setting for treat sphinx warnings as
errors is setting warning-is-error in build_sphinx section. Migrate
the setting from the old warnerrors one.

Fix also problems found:
* code-blocks that could not be parsed
* Usage of :option: without declaring the option.
* Add blank lines to properly end markup.
* Fix a typo.
* Fix wrong markup of docstring
* Fix title underlinings.

Change-Id: I69ddde706a04f26bfccda072822dc0d230cb330e

commit_message:
Remove raise from LOG.exception

There is a little problem in _flush function. This patch correct it.
Remove "raise", we log the exception.

Aslo, remove the duplicate logic in _get_filters_from_rules.

commit_message:
Update to a newer hacking library

The older hacking library has a cap on pbr <2.0, with the recent 2.0.0
release of PBR it's causing failures in the pep8 job.

hacking isn't kept in sync via the typical proposal-bot updates.

Do it manually to clear the gate issue.

pep8 runtests: commands[0] | flake8
./os_collect_config/merger.py:45:22: W292 no newline at end of file
    return final_list

Change-Id: If863d2e190a4e1701ebf1fcb99a783075cda2556
Related-Bug: #1668848

commit_message:
Fix api-ref building

The current os-api-ref and Sphinx packages warn about a couple of
problems. Fix them all:
* wrong order of entries in parameters.yaml
* missing parameter
* too short underline

Also, treat warnings as errors for Sphinx to avoid regressions.

Change-Id: Id129cc709df38385a8cfe6dc12ffca6d4ba4857e

subject: Set correct content-type for o-r-c curl calls
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-03 14:33:31.000000000', 'files': ['elements/os-refresh-config/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/99-refresh-completed'], 'message': "Set correct content-type for o-r-c curl calls

They contained json data, so they need application/json as the
content types. Else, some wsgi implementations will interpret the
contents in an undesired way, such as apache's mod_wsgi setting the
whole POST body as a POST parameter with no value.

Change-Id: Id988e8d286761550da4849c0695f5f5a37116a11
Closes-Bug: #1641589
(cherry picked from commit 8688c2878a20af1e4a0b2ac3692f17be98d755c6)
"}]
commit_message:
Set correct content-type for o-r-c curl calls

They contained json data, so they need application/json as the
content types. Else, some wsgi implementations will interpret the
contents in an undesired way, such as apache's mod_wsgi setting the
whole POST body as a POST parameter with no value.

Change-Id: Id988e8d286761550da4849c0695f5f5a37116a11
Closes-Bug: #1641589
(cherry picked from commit 8688c2878a20af1e4a0b2ac3692f17be98d755c6)

subject: Update to a newer hacking library
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-02 09:54:23.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Update to a newer hacking library

The older hacking library has a cap on pbr <2.0, with the recent 2.0.0
release of PBR it's causing failures in the pep8 job. hacking isn't
kept in sync via the typical proposal-bot updates. Do it manually to
clear the gate issue.

Change-Id: I5d78d4c3487dbe1ba93fcbc104427da1e7dd9ef5
Related-Bug: #1668848
"}]
commit_message:
Update to a newer hacking library

The older hacking library has a cap on pbr <2.0, with the recent 2.0.0
release of PBR it's causing failures in the pep8 job. hacking isn't
kept in sync via the typical proposal-bot updates. Do it manually to
clear the gate issue.

Change-Id: I5d78d4c3487dbe1ba93fcbc104427da1e7dd9ef5
Related-Bug: #1668848

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-02-23 18:33:21.000000000', 'files': ['kolla/image/build.py'], 'message': "Improve kolla image build script for finding parent images

This change updates the image script to search for the parent image via the
Docker 'FROM' tag throughout the Dockerfile. The script previously checked
for parent name of an image, assuming that first line of Dockerfile always
starts with FROM, but that is not always the case when using custom
Dockerfiles.

Change-Id: I176d99f4e4896b64435e495526154c8f4c684839
Closes-Bug: #1656206
"}]
commit_message:
Improve kolla image build script for finding parent images

This change updates the image script to search for the parent image via the
Docker 'FROM' tag throughout the Dockerfile. The script previously checked
for parent name of an image, assuming that first line of Dockerfile always
starts with FROM, but that is not always the case when using custom
Dockerfiles.

Change-Id: I176d99f4e4896b64435e495526154c8f4c684839
Closes-Bug: #1656206

subject: Tags and Metadata fields with unicode cannot be correctly displayed
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-03-05 09:37:56.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/functional/v2/test_servers.py', 'novaclient/utils.py'], 'message': 'Tags and Metadata fields with unicode cannot be correctly displayed

Currently, Tags(list) and Metadata(dict) fields of instance will
firstly transformed to str using jsondump first when display. And
cannot be correctly transfomed and displayed afterwards.

This patch adds ensure_ascii=False to the transform function thus
those fields can be correctly tranformed and displayed afterwards.

Change-Id: Ib4e7a34f3b19db89280cc73053acbac8c8816f85
Closes-Bug: #1669683
'}]
commit_message:
Tags and Metadata fields with unicode cannot be correctly displayed

Currently, Tags(list) and Metadata(dict) fields of instance will
firstly transformed to str using jsondump first when display. And
cannot be correctly transfomed and displayed afterwards.

This patch adds ensure_ascii=False to the transform function thus
those fields can be correctly tranformed and displayed afterwards.

Change-Id: Ib4e7a34f3b19db89280cc73053acbac8c8816f85
Closes-Bug: #1669683

The patch also improves the System's unit-test coverage that was down to

Change-Id: I6b7d91c9f91ac2f6d3c748d255e446d8125d886d

commit_message:
Change get_allowed_*() methods return type from list to set

This patch is changing the System's
get_allowed_system_boot_source_values() and
get_allowed_reset_system_values() methods return values to be a set()
instead of list.

The patch also improves the System's unit-test coverage that was down to
86% before and now is at 96%.

Change-Id: I6b7d91c9f91ac2f6d3c748d255e446d8125d886d

subject: Switch devstack to use qcow cirros img
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-16 17:42:47.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tempest', 'stackrc'], 'message': "Switch devstack to use qcow cirros img

This commit switches devstack to use the published qcow2 cirros image
instead of the AMI version. Using AMI was mostly a historical artifact
dating pretty far back, but in the real world no one really uses AMI
images with openstack clouds. This change reflects that and also
enables tempest ro remove its deprecated config options for using AMI
as a fallback on misconfiguration (which was just there to support
devstack's defaults)

Change-Id: Id65ebae73b28da7185cb349b714b659af51ef77f
(cherry picked from commit 6fc332d85279865c32f50b081efb25ba7b671a9a)
"}]
commit_message:
Switch devstack to use qcow cirros img

This commit switches devstack to use the published qcow2 cirros image
instead of the AMI version. Using AMI was mostly a historical artifact
dating pretty far back, but in the real world no one really uses AMI
images with openstack clouds. This change reflects that and also
enables tempest ro remove its deprecated config options for using AMI
as a fallback on misconfiguration (which was just there to support
devstack's defaults)

Change-Id: Id65ebae73b28da7185cb349b714b659af51ef77f
(cherry picked from commit 6fc332d85279865c32f50b081efb25ba7b671a9a)

subject: Handle readfp deprecation
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-03-02 07:26:27.000000000', 'files': ['tools/trove-pylint.config', 'trove/common/stream_codecs.py'], 'message': 'Handle readfp deprecation

In py3.4 notice method readfp will removed in the future,so use
method readfile to replace it.This warning is only in py3 and
above.Py2,configparse do not have.Actually in py3,This function
is finally pointed to the readfile function

warnings.warn(
            "This method will be removed in future versions.  "
            "Use 'parser.read_file()' instead.",
            DeprecationWarning, stacklevel=2
        )
self.read_file(fp, source=filename)

Change-Id: I22a2dca71008469a8c8b7afcc0934f3b4adcdae4
'}]
commit_message:
Handle readfp deprecation

In py3.4 notice method readfp will removed in the future,so use
method readfile to replace it.This warning is only in py3 and
above.Py2,configparse do not have.Actually in py3,This function
is finally pointed to the readfile function

warnings.warn(
            "This method will be removed in future versions.  "
            "Use 'parser.read_file()' instead.",
            DeprecationWarning, stacklevel=2
        )
self.read_file(fp, source=filename)

Change-Id: I22a2dca71008469a8c8b7afcc0934f3b4adcdae4

commit_message:
Add idempotent_id decorator to tempest testcases

The idempotent_id decorator allows for tracking of tests even
after they have been renamed [1]. This patch adds idempotent_id
decorator to api related testcases for mistral_tempest_tests.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/
    HACKING.rst#test-identification-with-idempotent-id

Change-Id: I70f5ec2e18fd0845b7189b26cb40b9b260126146
Partial-Implements: blueprint add-idempotentid

run time by around 25-30 seconds.

subject: Allow to add non-CRUD methods to v2_0.client thru client extension
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-04-21 14:49:15.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/common/extension.py', 'doc/source/devref/client_command_extensions.rst', 'neutronclient/v2_0/client.py', 'neutronclient/tests/unit/test_client_extension.py', 'releasenotes/notes/extension-for-python-binding-5a6fb32bca3441e5.yaml', 'neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/contrib/_fox_sockets.py'], 'message': 'Allow to add non-CRUD methods to v2_0.client thru client extension

Previously in the neutronclient extension, non-CRUD methods cannot
be added to the client library, even though we can add arbitrary
subcommands to neutron CLI. As a result, a developer of an extension
cannot define non-CRUD commands in an easy way.

This patch allows to add custom methods to the client library class.

Change-Id: I00bb7d18bf896a7791a40f6c23461e219036abb3
Closes-Bug: #1549876
'}]
commit_message:
Allow to add non-CRUD methods to v2_0.client thru client extension

Previously in the neutronclient extension, non-CRUD methods cannot
be added to the client library, even though we can add arbitrary
subcommands to neutron CLI. As a result, a developer of an extension
cannot define non-CRUD commands in an easy way.

This patch allows to add custom methods to the client library class.

Change-Id: I00bb7d18bf896a7791a40f6c23461e219036abb3
Closes-Bug: #1549876
